He is wearing a black outfit and fedora, while the image was taken in black-and-white. | border = yes | type = single | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = [[Justified (album)|Justified]] | released = {{Start date|2002|08|26}} | format = *[[12-inch single]] *[[CD single]] *[[Maxi single]] | recorded = 2002 | studio = Master Sound Recording Studios ([[Virginia Beach, Virginia]])
Windmark Recording (Virginia Beach, Virginia) | venue = | genre = {{Flat list| *[[Contemporary R&B|Hip hop]]}} | length = {{Duration|m=4|s=43}} | label = [[Jive Records|Jive]] | writer = {{Flat list| *Justin Timberlake *[[Chad Hugo]] *[[Pharrell Williams]]}} *[[Pusha T]] *[[No Malice]] | producer = [[The Neptunes]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = [[Cry Me a River (Justin Timberlake song)|Cry Me a River]] | next_year = 2002}} "'''Like I Love You'''" is the debut single recorded by American singer-songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]] for his debut studio album, ''[[Justified (album)|Justified]]'' (2002), which features American [[hip hop music|hip hop]] duo [[Clipse]]. It was co-written by Timberlake and [[The Neptunes]] ([[Chad Hugo]] and [[Pharrell Williams]]), who also produced it. The song was released on August 26, 2002, as Timberlake's debut solo single, following the announced hiatus of [[NSYNC]] earlier that year. According to Williams, the song's drums were an ode to the [[funk]] era. The song peaked at number 11 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and number two in the United Kingdom.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/2366375.stm|title=Timberlake fails to top chart|work=[[BBC News]]|publisher=[[BBC|British Broadcasting Corporation]]|date=27 October 2002|accessdate=25 May 2009}} It was performed by Timberlake at the [[2002 MTV Video Music Awards]] in [[New York City]], on August 29, 2002. It also received a nomination at the [[Grammy Awards of 2003]] for [[Grammy Award for Best Rap/Sung Collaboration|Best Rap/Sung Collaboration]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1459402/20030107/nelly.jhtml|title=Eminem, Avril, Norah Jones nab most Grammy noms|first=Joe|last=D'Angelo|date=7 January 2003|work=[[MTV News]]|publisher=[[MTV]]|accessdate=25 May 2003}} == Writing and recording == {{multiple image | align = right | total_width = 250 | image1 = Chadhugo (300dpi).jpg | width1 = 120 | image2 = N.E.R.D @ Pori Jazz 2010 - Pharrell Williams 1.jpg | footer = [[Chad Hugo]] (''left'') and [[Pharrell Williams]] (''right'') co-wrote the song with Timberlake. }} ''[[MTV News]]'' reported in July 2002 that [[Chad Hugo]] and [[Pharrell Williams]] (known collectively as [[The Neptunes]]) were working on multiple tracks for ''Justified''.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1456207/timberlake-solo-lp-tightly-guarded.jhtml|title=Justin Timberlake Working 'NSecret On Star-Packed Solo LP|last=Moss|first=Corey|date=July 23, 2002|publisher=[[MTV News]]. [[Viacom (2005–present)|Viacom]]|accessdate=February 26, 2013}} When the duo picked Timberlake up from his hotel in [[Virginia Beach]], they listened to [[Earth, Wind & Fire]] albums during the car ride. The background of the songs was the feeling the duo wanted to implement into the musical content of the album.{{cite news|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1457175/preview-timberlake-album.jhtml|title=Preview Of Justin Timberlake Album From Neptunes' Hugo|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|date=August 26, 2002|publisher=MTV News. Viacom|accessdate=February 28, 2013}} In response to this, Timberlake said: "Nobody's ever heard anything like that before ... a white boy singing this kind of music." Hugo revealed that Timberlake "didn't care what people would say." The production duo commented that despite not being content with sampling music, for inspiration, they listened to both ''[[Off the Wall (album)|Off the Wall]]'' and ''[[Thriller (Michael Jackson album)|Thriller]]'', albums by [[Michael Jackson]]. Hugo commented that "We just wanted to re-create that sense of those timeless, classic songs, without any of the 'bling, bling, hit me on my two-way' style of the new R&B. It has elements of the old and the new." "Like I Love You" was the first song they recorded together and the first song Timberlake recorded for ''Justified''.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1457770/janet-gets-sexy-on-justin-cd.jhtml|title=Timberlake, Janet Jackson Make Sexy Pair on Justified|author=MTV News Staff|website=[[MTV News]]|date=September 24, 2002|access-date=February 25, 2020}} The song was written by Timberlake, Hugo and Williams, while the production was done by the latter two. The song features a [[rap music|rap verse]] written and performed by hip hop duo [[Clipse]]. "Like I Love You" was recorded at Master Sound Recording Studios and Windmark Recording both located in [[Virginia Beach]] with Andrew Coleman serving as a [[recording engineer]]. Serban Ghenea [[Mixing (music production)|mixed]] the song at Windmark Recording, while Daniel Botancourt and Tim Roberts were additional engineers. John Hanes provided the additional Pro Tools engineering. All the [[Instrumentation (music)|instrumentation]] was delivered by Hugo and Williams, while the song's vocal arrangement was provided by Williams together with Timberlake. ==Release== "Like I Love You" was chosen as Timberlake's debut single and the [[lead single]] of ''Justified''. According to Timberlake, there was "never any question" in his mind whether or not the song would be released as his debut single. Of the song, Timberlake said: "It sounded so original to me. And I kind of consider myself a new artist. This is a new beginning for me, so why call on some big-name hip-hop artist when I could get somebody that feels new so it could feel like we were {{sic|chomping|hide=y}} at the bit at the same time?" On October 14, 2002, a [[CD single]] was released in Germany containing the album version of the song, its instrumental and two club extended mixes. The same version of the single was released in Canada on October 17, 2002. In the UK, the album version of "Like I Love You", its instrumental and one extended remix was physically released on October 22, 2002. The song was released as a [[12-inch single|12" vinyl]] on November 19, 2002, in Italy and Spain. On November 24, 2002, it was also released in France as a CD single. ==Critical reception== {{Quote box|width=300px|align=right|quote="This is quite possibly the best post-boy-band debut single of all time. He booked the hottest producers (The Neptunes) and a bubbling-under hip-hop duo (Clipse) to show that the bubblegum had officially popped. There couldn't have been a better introduction to Justin Timberlake, solo star."|source=—''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s Katie Atkinson in 2016.{{Cite news |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7357881/justin-timberlake-singles-ranked-cant-stop-the-feeling |title=Critic's Choice: Every Justin Timberlake Single Ranked |last=Atkinson |first=Katie |date=May 6, 2016 |work=Billboard |access-date=June 18, 2017}}}} The song received positive reviews from music critics. ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''{{'}}s Craig Seymour wrote "Over a lo-fi [[The Neptunes|Neptunes]]-produced track dashed with Spanish guitar, live drums, and ''Planet Rock''-like electro bleeps... [Justin proves that] while no innovator, he is a fine student".{{cite magazine |first=Craig |last=Seymour |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,348170,00.html |title=Music Capsule review - Like I Love You |magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |accessdate=May 25, 2009 |date=September 13, 2002}} In his review of the album ''Justified'' for ''[[Rolling Stone]]'', Ben Ratliff wrote "In Like I Love You, a nasty funk rhythm on loud, live drums shares the space with a tiny guitar strum and Timberlake's breathy, studied tenor; it's minimalism influenced by Michael Jackson. But a softer, harmony-and-hook-filled chorus sets it off, thus pleasing preteen girls and beat junkies alike."{{cite magazine |first=Ben |last=Ratliff |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/justintimberlake/albums/album/104698/review/6068220/justified |title=Justin Timberlake: Justified: Music Review |magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] |date=November 4, 2002 |accessdate=May 25, 2009}} Denise Boyd, writing for [[BBC|BBC Music]], said that the song was a "sure bet for success" with The Neptunes producing the song but "Justin's vocal arrangement has given this offering a distinctive edge and it stands out as one of the best Neptunes productions this year."{{cite web |first=Denise |last=Boyd|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/reviews/vdmq |title=BBC Music - Review of Justin Timberlake - Justified |work=BBC Music |publisher=[[BBC|British Broadcasting Corporation]] |date=20 November 2002 |accessdate=25 May 2009}} ''[[Slant Magazine]]'' called it a "well-oiled Neptunes production" and "the acoustic guitar loops and snap-crackle-pop percussion of "Like I Love You" pick up where [[NSYNC]]'s hit "[[Girlfriend (NSYNC song)|Girlfriend]]" left off."{{cite magazine |first=Sal |last=Cinquemani |url=http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/music_review.asp?ID=230 |title=Justin Timberlake: Justified - Music review |magazine=[[Slant Magazine]] |date=November 8, 2002 |accessdate=25 May 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100115230559/http://slantmagazine.com/music/music_review.asp?ID=230 |archivedate=January 15, 2010 }} In 2013, Lauren Nostro from ''[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]'' wrote, "The song catapulted Timberlake's career... It was the quintessential R&B/pop/hip-hop track filled with soulful lyrics and a heavy beat. It presented JT as a full-fledged musician, and not just the lead singer of 'N Sync."{{Cite news |url=http://www.complex.com/music/2013/03/the-25-best-justin-timberlake-songs/justin-timberlake-like-i-love-you |title=The 25 Best Justin Timberlake Songs |date=March 15, 2013 |work=Complex |access-date=June 18, 2017}} Adelle Platon from ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' opined in 2016, "This groovy number cemented J.T.'s solo career as a genre-fusing wunderkind."{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/hip-hop/7633393/justin-timberlake-best-hip-hop-rb-collaborations|title=Justin Timberlake's 14 Best Hip-Hop/R&B Collaborations|last=Platon|first=Adelle|date=December 27, 2016|website=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=June 18, 2017}} In 2017, ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]'' staff ranked it as the best boy-band solo debut single.{{cite web|url=http://www.spin.com/2017/04/boy-band-solo-singles-ranked/|title=Best Boy Band Solo Debut Singles, Ranked|date=April 20, 2017|website=[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]|author=Spin Staff|access-date=July 12, 2017}} ==Chart performance== "Like I Love You" debuted on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] at number 67 for the issue dated September 7, 2002.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2002-09-14/hot-100?order=gainer|title=The Hot 100 : Sep 14, 2002 - Billboard Chart Archives|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=March 15, 2013}} The next week it climbed to number 46. It eventually reached a peak of number 11 and stayed on the chart for total of 36 weeks. The song was more successful on the US [[Pop Songs]] and [[Hot Dance Club Songs]] charts where it peaked at number four and one respectively. Additionally it charted on the US [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] chart where reached a peak of 53. The song was more successful in Oceania. On the [[Australian Singles Chart]], the song debuted at number nine for the week dated October 27, 2002. The next week it fell to number 11, before eventually reaching its peak of number eight in its third week; the single stayed on its peak position for three consecutive weeks. "Like I Love You" stayed on the chart for a total of twelve weeks. The song was certified platinum by the [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] (ARIA) for shipments of 70,000 units.{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-accreditations-singles-2002.htm|title=ARIA Charts – Accreditations – 2002 Singles |publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association]] |accessdate=April 11, 2011}} It debuted and peaked at number six on the [[New Zealand Singles Chart]] for the week dated November 10, 2002. The song stayed on the chart for twelve weeks. In the United Kingdom, "Like I Love You" debuted at its peak of number two for the issue dated November 2, 2002.{{cite web|url=https://www.officialcharts.com/search/singles/Like+I+Love+You|title=The Official Charts Company - Like I Love You by Justin Timberlake Search |date=6 May 2013|publisher=The Official Charts Company}} It stayed on the chart for total of 16 weeks, with its last appearance being on February 15, 2003 at number 57. The song debuted and peaked at number five on the [[Irish Singles Chart]]. "Like I Love You" debuted at its peak of number four on the [[Danish Singles Chart]] and managed to stay on the position for two consecutive weeks, before starting to fell on the chart. It stayed on the chart for total of 14 weeks. The single debuted at number 14 on the [[Norwegian Singles Chart]] for the week dated October 25, 2002. After three weeks, "Like I Love You" managed to reach its peak of number 10 on the chart. Additionally, the song charted and peaked at number 14 on the [[Swiss Singles Chart]]. ==Music video== ===Background=== The official music video was released on September 9, 2002, as featured in an episode of [[MTV]]'s ''[[Making the Video]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1457095/justin-timberlake-to-play-vmas-says-solo-debut-is-very-me/|title=Justin Timberlake To Play VMAs, Says Solo Debut Is 'Very Me'|last=Dangelo|first=Joe|website=[[MTV News]]|date=August 20, 2002|access-date=February 25, 2020}} It was filmed in Weston, Ontario, Canada, and was directed by [[Diane Martel]] from August 22–24, 2002.{{citation needed|date=April 2020}} As of May 2020, the music video has over 85.5 million views on [[YouTube]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FQ3slUz7Jo8&loop=0|title=Justin Timberlake - Like I Love You (Official Music Video)|via=[[YouTube]]|date=October 2, 2009|access-date= August 31, 2019}}
